exercises.title: Technical Debt Management
exercises.description: Complete the text about technical debt
exercises.content: Understanding and managing technical debt is crucial for long-term software sustainability.

questions.text: Technical debt occurs when development teams choose a quick solution now instead of ___ a better approach that would take longer.
questions.explanation: The preposition 'instead of' is followed by a gerund (verb + -ing). Common verbs here include 'using', 'implementing', or 'adopting'.

questions.text: When debt accumulates, developers spend more time fixing bugs ___ building new features.
questions.explanation: 'More...than' is used for comparisons. The sentence structure is 'spend more time doing X than doing Y'.

questions.text: Regular refactoring ___ debt from becoming overwhelming.
questions.explanation: The verb must agree with the singular subject 'refactoring' and fit the meaning of stopping something negative. 'Prevents' is most common, but 'stops' or 'keeps' (with 'from') also work.

exercises.title: Angular Memory Leaks
exercises.description: Complete the text about preventing memory leaks in Angular
exercises.content: Memory leaks in Angular can severely degrade application performance.

questions.text: The most frequent cause of memory leaks in Angular ___ failing to unsubscribe from Observables.
questions.explanation: The subject 'cause' is singular, so we use 'is'. This is present simple tense for a general fact.

questions.text: Event listeners attached to DOM elements must ___ when components are destroyed.
questions.explanation: This requires passive voice (must + be + past participle) because the focus is on the action, not who performs it.

questions.text: Angular's async pipe ___ handles subscriptions and unsubscriptions, eliminating many potential memory leaks.
questions.explanation: An adverb is needed to modify the verb 'handles'. 'Automatically' means it happens without manual intervention.

exercises.title: EU AI Act Compliance
exercises.description: Complete the text about AI Act requirements
exercises.content: The EU AI Act establishes comprehensive regulation for artificial intelligence systems.

questions.text: The AI Act follows a risk-based approach, ___ regulatory attention is focused on high-risk applications.
questions.explanation: These formal connectors introduce a clause explaining how the risk-based approach works. 'Whereby' is most formal and common in legal/regulatory contexts.

questions.text: High-risk AI systems must ___ with stringent requirements including risk management and detailed documentation.
questions.explanation: 'Comply with' means to obey or follow rules/regulations. Modal 'must' is followed by the base form of the verb.

questions.text: Non-compliance can result ___ administrative fines up to â‚¬35 million or 7% of worldwide annual turnover.
questions.explanation: 'Result in' is a phrasal verb meaning to cause or lead to a particular outcome. The preposition 'in' is fixed.

exercises.title: DevOps Culture and Practices
exercises.description: Complete the text about DevOps principles
exercises.content: DevOps transforms how organizations develop and deploy software.

questions.text: DevOps eliminates the traditional wall between development and operations, ___ teams to work together throughout the software lifecycle.
questions.explanation: These verbs + object + to-infinitive show that DevOps makes it possible for teams to collaborate. 'Enabling' is most common in this context.

questions.text: CI/CD pipelines ___ build, test, and deploy code changes without manual intervention.
questions.explanation: An adverb is needed to describe how the pipelines work. 'Automatically' emphasizes the automation aspect central to CI/CD.

questions.text: Infrastructure as Code treats infrastructure configuration as software, ___ in version control.
questions.explanation: Past participle functioning as a reduced relative clause ('which is stored'). This describes the state of the configuration.

exercises.title: Zero Trust Security
exercises.description: Complete the text about Zero Trust architecture
exercises.content: Zero Trust security represents a paradigm shift in cybersecurity.

questions.text: Zero Trust architecture operates on the principle ___ no user or device should be trusted by default.
questions.explanation: The conjunction 'that' introduces a noun clause explaining what the principle states. This is common after abstract nouns like 'principle', 'fact', 'idea'.

questions.text: Unlike traditional security models ___ trust internal network traffic, Zero Trust verifies everything.
questions.explanation: A relative pronoun is needed to connect the clause describing traditional models. 'Which' (more formal) or 'that' both work here.

questions.text: Access decisions are made in real-time based on contextual factors such as user behavior, device health, and location, ___ than relying solely on network perimeter.
questions.explanation: 'Rather than' introduces a preferred alternative. It's more formal than 'instead of' and common in technical writing.
